      32                 :            : #include <QFlags>

      34                 :            : #include "o0baseauth.h"
      35                 :            : 
      36                 :            : /**
      37                 :            :   @short Simple encryption and decryption of strings and byte arrays
      38                 :            : 
      39                 :            :   This class provides a simple implementation of encryption and decryption
      40                 :            :   of strings and byte arrays.
      41                 :            : 
      42                 :            :   @warning The encryption provided by this class is NOT strong encryption. It may
      43                 :            :   help to shield things from curious eyes, but it will NOT stand up to someone
      44                 :            :   determined to break the encryption. Don't say you were not warned.
      45                 :            : 
      46                 :            :   The class uses a 64 bit key. Simply create an instance of the class, set the key,
      47                 :            :   and use the encryptToString() method to calculate an encrypted version of the input string.
      48                 :            :   To decrypt that string again, use an instance of SimpleCrypt initialized with
      49                 :            :   the same key, and call the decryptToString() method with the encrypted string. If the key
      50                 :            :   matches, the decrypted version of the string will be returned again.
      51                 :            : 
      52                 :            :   If you do not provide a key, or if something else is wrong, the encryption and
      53                 :            :   decryption function will return an empty string or will return a string containing nonsense.
      54                 :            :   lastError() will return a value indicating if the method was succesful, and if not, why not.
      55                 :            : 
      56                 :            :   SimpleCrypt is prepared for the case that the encryption and decryption
      57                 :            :   algorithm is changed in a later version, by prepending a version identifier to the cypertext.
      58                 :            :   */
      59                 :          0 : class O0_EXPORT O0SimpleCrypt
      60                 :            : {
      61                 :            : public:
      62                 :            :     /**
      63                 :            :       CompressionMode describes if compression will be applied to the data to be
      64                 :            :       encrypted.
      65                 :            :       */
      66                 :            :     enum CompressionMode {
      67                 :            :         CompressionAuto,    /*!< Only apply compression if that results in a shorter plaintext. */
      68                 :            :         CompressionAlways,  /*!< Always apply compression. Note that for short inputs, a compression may result in longer data */
      69                 :            :         CompressionNever    /*!< Never apply compression. */
      70                 :            :     };
      71                 :            :     /**
      72                 :            :       IntegrityProtectionMode describes measures taken to make it possible to detect problems with the data
      73                 :            :       or wrong decryption keys.
      74                 :            : 
      75                 :            :       Measures involve adding a checksum or a cryptograhpic hash to the data to be encrypted. This
      76                 :            :       increases the length of the resulting cypertext, but makes it possible to check if the plaintext
      77                 :            :       appears to be valid after decryption.
      78                 :            :     */
      79                 :            :     enum IntegrityProtectionMode {
      80                 :            :         ProtectionNone,    /*!< The integerity of the encrypted data is not protected. It is not really possible to detect a wrong key, for instance. */
      81                 :            :         ProtectionChecksum,/*!< A simple checksum is used to verify that the data is in order. If not, an empty string is returned. */
      82                 :            :         ProtectionHash     /*!< A cryptographic hash is used to verify the integrity of the data. This method produces a much stronger, but longer check */
      83                 :            :     };
      84                 :            :     /**
      85                 :            :       Error describes the type of error that occurred.
      86                 :            :       */
      87                 :            :     enum Error {
      88                 :            :         ErrorNoError,         /*!< No error occurred. */
      89                 :            :         ErrorNoKeySet,        /*!< No key was set. You can not encrypt or decrypt without a valid key. */
      90                 :            :         ErrorUnknownVersion,  /*!< The version of this data is unknown, or the data is otherwise not valid. */
      91                 :            :         ErrorIntegrityFailed  /*!< The integrity check of the data failed. Perhaps the wrong key was used. */
      92                 :            :     };
      93                 :            : 
      94                 :            :     /**
      95                 :            :       Constructor.
      96                 :            : 
      97                 :            :       Constructs a SimpleCrypt instance without a valid key set on it.
      98                 :            :      */
      99                 :            :     O0SimpleCrypt();
     100                 :            :     /**
     101                 :            :       Constructor.
     102                 :            : 
     103                 :            :       Constructs a SimpleCrypt instance and initializes it with the given @arg key.
     104                 :            :      */
     105                 :            :     explicit O0SimpleCrypt(quint64 key);
     106                 :            : 
     107                 :            :     /**
     108                 :            :       (Re-) initializes the key with the given @arg key.
     109                 :            :       */
     110                 :            :     void setKey(quint64 key);
     111                 :            :     /**
     112                 :            :       Returns true if SimpleCrypt has been initialized with a key.
     113                 :            :       */
     114                 :            :     bool hasKey() const {return !m_keyParts.isEmpty();}
     115                 :            : 
     116                 :            :     /**
     117                 :            :       Sets the compression mode to use when encrypting data. The default mode is Auto.
     118                 :            : 
     119                 :            :       Note that decryption is not influenced by this mode, as the decryption recognizes
     120                 :            :       what mode was used when encrypting.
     121                 :            :       */
     122                 :            :     void setCompressionMode(CompressionMode mode) {m_compressionMode = mode;}
     123                 :            :     /**
     124                 :            :       Returns the CompressionMode that is currently in use.
     125                 :            :       */
     126                 :            :     CompressionMode compressionMode() const {return m_compressionMode;}
     127                 :            : 
     128                 :            :     /**
     129                 :            :       Sets the integrity mode to use when encrypting data. The default mode is Checksum.
     130                 :            : 
     131                 :            :       Note that decryption is not influenced by this mode, as the decryption recognizes
     132                 :            :       what mode was used when encrypting.
     133                 :            :       */
     134                 :            :     void setIntegrityProtectionMode(IntegrityProtectionMode mode) {m_protectionMode = mode;}
     135                 :            :     /**
     136                 :            :       Returns the IntegrityProtectionMode that is currently in use.
     137                 :            :       */
     138                 :            :     IntegrityProtectionMode integrityProtectionMode() const {return m_protectionMode;}
     139                 :            : 
     140                 :            :     /**
     141                 :            :       Returns the last error that occurred.
     142                 :            :       */
     143                 :            :     Error lastError() const {return m_lastError;}
     144                 :            : 
     145                 :            :     /**
     146                 :            :       Encrypts the @arg plaintext string with the key the class was initialized with, and returns
     147                 :            :       a cyphertext the result. The result is a base64 encoded version of the binary array that is the
     148                 :            :       actual result of the string, so it can be stored easily in a text format.
     149                 :            :       */
     150                 :            :     QString encryptToString(const QString& plaintext) ;
     151                 :            :     /**
     152                 :            :       Encrypts the @arg plaintext QByteArray with the key the class was initialized with, and returns
     153                 :            :       a cyphertext the result. The result is a base64 encoded version of the binary array that is the
     154                 :            :       actual result of the encryption, so it can be stored easily in a text format.
     155                 :            :       */
     156                 :            :     QString encryptToString(QByteArray plaintext) ;
     157                 :            :     /**
     158                 :            :       Encrypts the @arg plaintext string with the key the class was initialized with, and returns
     159                 :            :       a binary cyphertext in a QByteArray the result.
     160                 :            : 
     161                 :            :       This method returns a byte array, that is useable for storing a binary format. If you need
     162                 :            :       a string you can store in a text file, use encryptToString() instead.
     163                 :            :       */
     164                 :            :     QByteArray encryptToByteArray(const QString& plaintext) ;
     165                 :            :     /**
     166                 :            :       Encrypts the @arg plaintext QByteArray with the key the class was initialized with, and returns
     167                 :            :       a binary cyphertext in a QByteArray the result.
     168                 :            : 
     169                 :            :       This method returns a byte array, that is useable for storing a binary format. If you need
     170                 :            :       a string you can store in a text file, use encryptToString() instead.
     171                 :            :       */
     172                 :            :     QByteArray encryptToByteArray(QByteArray plaintext) ;
     173                 :            : 
     174                 :            :     /**
     175                 :            :       Decrypts a cyphertext string encrypted with this class with the set key back to the
     176                 :            :       plain text version.
     177                 :            : 
     178                 :            :       If an error occurred, such as non-matching keys between encryption and decryption,
     179                 :            :       an empty string or a string containing nonsense may be returned.
     180                 :            :       */
     181                 :            :     QString decryptToString(const QString& cyphertext) ;
     182                 :            :     /**
     183                 :            :       Decrypts a cyphertext string encrypted with this class with the set key back to the
     184                 :            :       plain text version.
     185                 :            : 
     186                 :            :       If an error occurred, such as non-matching keys between encryption and decryption,
     187                 :            :       an empty string or a string containing nonsense may be returned.
     188                 :            :       */
     189                 :            :     QByteArray decryptToByteArray(const QString& cyphertext) ;
     190                 :            :     /**
     191                 :            :       Decrypts a cyphertext binary encrypted with this class with the set key back to the
     192                 :            :       plain text version.
     193                 :            : 
     194                 :            :       If an error occurred, such as non-matching keys between encryption and decryption,
     195                 :            :       an empty string or a string containing nonsense may be returned.
     196                 :            :       */
     197                 :            :     QString decryptToString(QByteArray cypher) ;
     198                 :            :     /**
     199                 :            :       Decrypts a cyphertext binary encrypted with this class with the set key back to the
     200                 :            :       plain text version.
     201                 :            : 
     202                 :            :       If an error occurred, such as non-matching keys between encryption and decryption,
     203                 :            :       an empty string or a string containing nonsense may be returned.
     204                 :            :       */
     205                 :            :     QByteArray decryptToByteArray(QByteArray cypher) ;
     206                 :            : 
     207                 :            :     //enum to describe options that have been used for the encryption. Currently only one, but
     208                 :            :     //that only leaves room for future extensions like adding a cryptographic hash...
     209                 :            :     enum CryptoFlag{CryptoFlagNone = 0,

     211                 :            :                     CryptoFlagChecksum = 0x02,
     212                 :            :                     CryptoFlagHash = 0x04
